from or referring to the period of time, between around 363 and 290 million years ago, when the first reptiles appeared and there were large forests covering the areas that later formed earth's coal layers: Sometimes you can see fossilised creatures that lived in the swamps of the Carboniferous era. Taking a closer look at Carboniferous rocks reveals distinct cycles in the rock layers, each covering around 100,000 years.
More examplesFewer examplesThis is what happened in the Carboniferous swamps.The late Carboniferous forests around the northern hemisphere were far more alike than the modern ones.We do know that most coal fields began life as swamps about 300 million years ago in the Carboniferous period.

the period of time, between around 363 and 290 million years ago, when the first reptiles appeared and there were large forests covering the areas that later formed earth's coal layers: Most coal fields began as swamps in the Carboniferous. In the Carboniferous, the Appalachian mountains were about the size of the Himalayas.
More examplesFewer examplesThere were freshwater sharks in the rivers and lakes that dominated the area during the Carboniferous.This creature lived in the Carboniferous, before dinosaurs existed. Slate was originally laid down as layers of fine silt during the Carboniferous.
